wikipedia_page.main: Albert Thomas Lyons (5 March 1902 – 10 May 1981) was a professional footballer who played at full-back for Port Vale, Walsall, Clapton Orient, Tottenham Hotspur and Colwyn Bay. One of four brothers, two of his siblings also played League football.

response: 10 May 1981: Bert Lyons, 79, played 76 league games for Orient between 1926 and 1930 before signing for Tottenham Hotspur and completing his league career with 54 league games in three years.
* Bert Lyons (trade unionist) (1929–2008), British trade unionist
* Bert Lyons (footballer) (Albert Thomas Lyons, 1902–1981), English footballer
* Bert Lyons (trade unionist) (Charles Albert Lyons, died 2008), British trade unionist
